title: Paul Dolan 2019 Made with Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This reasonably priced wine is arguably one of Mendocino County's best Cabernets, year in and year out. Aromatic, complex, nicely ripe and full in body, it starts with enticing aromas of toasted oak, pencil shavings and cigar box followed by deep layers of black cherry, blueberry, anise and cocoa. Moderate, well-integrated tannins beef up the texture nicely and bode well for mid-term aging. Best from 2026.

title: Soter 2018 Origin Series Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: One of five AVA-specific Pinots in this new series, this intensely aromatic offering bursts open with lush scents of blackberries, cocoa and baking spices. The grapes were sourced from Zena Crown and the Soter Vineyard, and 20% were whole cluster fermented. Dense and bright, it's a compelling and spicy wine with exceptional balance.

title: Amici 2018 Flora Marie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Full of salty minerality, this impressive white offers a well-diversified and integrated wealth of fruit, from peach and pear to pineapple, changing as it goes. The full-bodied lushness of texture remains fresh and exuberant throughout, showing a great deal of finesse.

title: Far Mountain 2019 Myrna Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: High-toned and floral, this wine offers a generous mouthfeel of salty oak, mineral and wet stone. The elegant fruit profile combines pear, apple and Meyer lemon with ease, complementing the body weight with ample acidity.

title: MacRostie 2018 Charles Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: From the great coastal site, this white sings in fruitful intensity and complex layers of flavor, a burst of Meyer lemon and grapefruit crispness complemented by richer undertones of Meyer lemon meringue and toasted pineapple.
